intro: Oxytropis gracilis, commonly known as slender locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has small, compound leaves and produces pods that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Oxytropis gracilis is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
